title: Ant-Man (soundtrack)
text:
Ant-Man (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) is the <a href="film%20score">film score</a> for the <a href="Marvel%20Studios">Marvel Studios</a> film "<a href="Ant-Man%20%28film%29">Ant-Man</a>". The score was composed by <a href="Christophe%20Beck">Christophe Beck</a>. <a href="Hollywood%20Records">Hollywood Records</a> released the album digitally on July 17, 2015, and in physical formats on August 7, 2015.
One additional song, "Plainsong" by <a href="The%20Cure">The Cure</a>, is featured in the movie, but was not included on the soundtrack album. <a href="Siri">Siri</a> plays the song as <a href="Yellowjacket%20%28Marvel%20Comics%29">Yellowjacket</a> and <a href="Ant-Man">Ant-Man</a> are fighting inside a briefcase near the end of the film.
Background.
In February 2014, director <a href="Edgar%20Wright">Edgar Wright</a> tweeted that <a href="Steven%20Price%20%28composer%29">Steven Price</a> would <a href="Film%20score">score</a> the film. However, Price left soon after Wright's departure from the project in May 2014. In January 2015, <a href="Christophe%20Beck">Christophe Beck</a>, who worked with Wright's replacement <a href="Peyton%20Reed">Peyton Reed</a> on "<a href="Bring%20It%20On%20%28film%29">Bring It On</a>", was hired to replace Price. Describing the film's score, Beck said, "For "Ant-Man", I wanted to write a score in the grand symphonic tradition of my favorite superhero movies, with a sweeping scope and a big, catchy main theme. What makes this score stand out among other Marvel movies, though, is a sneaky sense of fun since it is, after all, not only a superhero movie, but also a heist comedy." The soundtrack was released digitally on July 17, 2015, and in physical media on August 7.
